title: Google\Cloud\Monitoring\V3\Service
name: Service
description:
A Service is a discrete, autonomous, and network-accessible unit, designed to solve an individual concern (Wikipedia). In Cloud Monitoring, a Service acts as the root resource under which operational aspects of the service are accessible.

Generated from protobuf message google.monitoring.v3.Service

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Resource name for this Service. The format is: projects/[PROJECT_ID_OR_NUMBER]/services/[SERVICE_ID]

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: Name used for UI elements listing this Service.

params.name: data.custom
params.description: Custom service type.

params.name: data.app_engine
params.description: Type used for App Engine services.

params.name: data.cloud_endpoints
params.description: Type used for Cloud Endpoints services.

params.name: data.cluster_istio
params.description: Type used for Istio services that live in a Kubernetes cluster.

params.name: data.mesh_istio
params.description: Type used for Istio services scoped to an Istio mesh.

params.name: data.istio_canonical_service
params.description: Type used for canonical services scoped to an Istio mesh. Metrics for Istio are documented here

params.name: data.telemetry
params.description: Configuration for how to query telemetry on a Service.

params.name: data.user_labels
params.description: Labels which have been used to annotate the service. Label keys must start with a letter. Label keys and values may contain lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, and dashes. Label keys and values have a maximum length of 63 characters, and must be less than 128 bytes in size. Up to 64 label entries may be stored. For labels which do not have a semantic value, the empty string may be supplied for the label value.

methods.name: getUserLabels
methods.description:
Labels which have been used to annotate the service. Label keys must start with a letter. Label keys and values may contain lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, and dashes. Label keys and values have a maximum length of 63 characters, and must be less than 128 bytes in size. Up to 64 label entries may be stored. For labels which do not have a semantic value, the empty string may be supplied for the label value.
